data.event: Xiangtang (Chinese: 向塘; pinyin: xiàngtáng; literally: "face river bank"; Mandarin pronunciation: [ɕjɑ̃tʰɑ̃]) is a town located to the south of Nanchang, the capital of China's Jiangxi province, under the administration of Nanchang County It is the most populous town in the province with the population more than 150,000 as of the 2010 census.
The village experienced fast growth when the main part of the Zhejiang–Jiangxi Railway was completed in 1935.
It also had the only civilian airport(joint military/civilian) in Jiangxi province before Nanchang Changbei International Airport went to operation in September 10, 1999.
In 1999, Xiangtang became a provincial level development zone and boosted the medical, chemical, clothing, material industry and education.
